triples.name: Multimodal interaction
triples.relevance: The core concept of the survey, describing how users interact with systems through multiple communication channels like speech, gesture, and touch.

triples.name: Human-computer interaction
triples.relevance: The foundational field within which multimodal interaction research is situated, concerned with designing and evaluating interactive computing systems.

triples.name: Speech recognition
triples.relevance: A key input modality in multimodal systems that enables users to interact through spoken language.

triples.name: Gesture recognition
triples.relevance: An important input modality for multimodal interaction that interprets human hand and body gestures for system control.

triples.name: Touch user interface
triples.relevance: A primary input modality enabling users to interact with systems through tactile touch on screens and interfaces.

triples.name: Eye tracking
triples.relevance: An input modality that measures gaze direction and eye movement for hands-free multimodal interaction and accessibility applications.

triples.name: Sensor
triples.relevance: Fundamental hardware technology that detects and captures input from users and their environment in multimodal systems.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: Key technology enabling the recognition, interpretation, and fusion of multimodal inputs in intelligent interactive systems.

triples.name: Virtual assistant
triples.relevance: A practical application of multimodal interaction that combines speech, gesture, and other modalities for natural user interaction.

triples.name: Assistive technology
triples.relevance: An important application domain for multimodal systems, enabling individuals with disabilities to interact with technology through alternative modalities.

triples.name: Data fusion
triples.relevance: The technical process of combining information from multiple modalities to create coherent system understanding, central to multimodal fusion.

triples.name: Adaptive system
triples.relevance: Systems that adjust their behavior based on user input and context, a key characteristic of advanced multimodal interfaces.

triples.name: Context awareness
triples.relevance: The ability of systems to understand and respond to user context and environment, essential for seamless multimodal interaction.
